text: I learned by literally using the web inspector to mess with changes to the page, then replicating those changes in a file. This was five years ago. The landscape has gotten crazy complex since even then.

I feel old now. I started before the inspector, and before firebug existed.
I was just using View Source, and trial and error.

When the inspector came out it completely blew my mind. still does to this day - it’s gotten so sophisticated that the vast majority of front end web developers have never even seen/used all of it’s features/screens
client asked why their “recent events” module wasn’t showing upcoming events…
cant wait for the detective pikachu memes
i would like to hear the polite answer that was given in response

I was respectfully blunt and simply stated it shows the last 5 events that have occurred, and offered to make a clone of the module that shows upcoming.

What I wanted to send was: <https://media.giphy.com/media/toDvtq5PW1HIQ/giphy.gif>
also, David Tennant will be at c2e2 in chicago this year

<https://media.giphy.com/media/3oEjI5PXQRdol15MHe/giphy.gif>
my favorite is Matt Smith but Tenant is still amazing
